poem:
Eggs: A Meditation  

In the dawn's kitchen,  
the egg waits, curled  
in its shell—a world  
of potential, a yoke  
and white uncooked.  

There are a thousand pleats  
in the chef's hat,  
yet fewer are the prayers  
offered quietly  
to a life unbroken,  
a meal rising gently  
from mundane origins  
to fleeting grace.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "100 ways to cook an egg According to culinary lore, a traditional chef’s hat has 100 pleats to represent the number of ways there are to cook an egg. But are there really as many as 100 ways to cook an egg? No, there are probably a thousand ways to transform, adorn and cajole this most obliging ingredient. But here is a modest selection of 100 – just to get you started. Breakfast 1 Get". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
